title: How to Make a Virgin Mai Tai Cocktail

steps.headline: Combine the chopped whole almonds and ground almonds in a large pot.
Add 2 cups of the granulated sugar.
Add the mineral water and bring the mixture to a boil.
Cover the almond water and refrigerate it overnight.
Remove the almond water from the refrigerator and strain it through a cheesecloth or a fine sieve.
Pour the strained liquid into a large mixing bowl that is inscribed with measurements.
steps.description: Measure the quantity of almond water that you have.

steps.headline: Return the almond water to the pot.
Add 3-1/2 cups granulated sugar for every 1-1/2 cups of almond water that you measure.
Heat the almond water mixture over low heat until the liquid is simmering but not boiling.
steps.description: Cook the liquid until all of the sugar has dissolved.

steps.headline: Remove the syrup from the heat and allow it to cool.
Add a few drops of orange blossom water, rose water and bitter almond extract to the syrup.
steps.description: The syrup will have a golden color.

steps.headline: Pour the syrup into a sealable sterilized container and refrigerate it until you are ready to use it.
Pour the ingredients into a brandy snifter.
Stir all of the ingredients together with a spoon.
Add ice cubes and serve the drink with a wedge of orange or pineapple for garnish.
steps.description: You can also float a maraschino cherry in the drink for added color.
